question: 稼ぐ
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>earnings</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to earn income</vocabulary>, because you can't "to income" something. Can also be <vocabulary>to make money</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You earn your income, and every time you're paid, you're given your money in a brief<reading>case</reading> (<ja>かせ</ja>). Imagine getting your income from a briefcase, opening it up, and grabbing the money from within. Then, you have to give the briefcase back at the specified dropoff.
